name: CSES
discription: Luhtanen, R. , & Crocker, J. . (1992). A collective self-esteem scale: self-evaluation of one's social identity. Personality & Social Psychology Bulletin, 18(3), 302-318.doi10.1177/0146167292183006

questions.1: I am a worthy member of the social groups I belong to.
questions.2: I often regret that I belong to some of the social groups I do.
questions.3: Overall, my social groups are considered good by others.
questions.4: Overall, my group memberships have very little to do with how I feel about myself.
questions.5: I feel I don't have much to offer to the social groups I belong to.
questions.6: In general, I'm glad to be a member of the social groups I belong to.
questions.7: Most people consider my social groups, on the average, to be more ineffective than other social groups.
questions.8: The social groups I belong to are an important reflection of who I am.
questions.9: I am a cooperative participant in the social groups I belong to.
questions.10: Overall, I often feel that the social groups of which I am a member are not worthwhile.
questions.11: In general, others respect the social groups that I am a member of.
questions.12: The social groups I belong to are unimportant to my sense of what kind of a person I am.
questions.13: I often feel I'm a useless member of my social groups.
questions.14: I feel good about the social groups I belong to.
questions.15: In general, others think that the social groups I am a member of are unworthy.
questions.16: In general, belonging to social groups is an important part of my self image.

prompt: You should reply numbers from 1 to 7 in the following statements. Please evaluate the following descriptions based on your actual feelings and experiences. The criteria for evaluation and judgment are as follows: 1 (strongly disagree), 2 (disagree), 3 (slightly disagree), 4 (neutral), 5 (slightly agree), 6 (agree), 7 (strongly agree). Here are the statements, score them one by one:

name: CSE-R
discription: We are all members of different social groups or social categories. We would like you to consider your race or ethnicity (e.g., African-American, Latino/Latina, Asian, European-American) in responding to the following statements.

questions.1: I am a worthy member of my race group.
questions.2: I often regret that I belong to my racial group.
questions.3: Overall, my racial group is considered good by others.
questions.4: Overall, my raceity has very little to do with how I feel about myself.
questions.5: I feel I don't have much to offer to my racial group.
questions.6: In general, I'm glad to be a member of my racial group.
questions.7: Most people consider my racial group, on the average, to be more ineffective than other groups.
questions.8: The racial group I belong to is an important reflection of who I am.
questions.9: I am a cooperative participant in the activities of my racial group.
questions.10: Overall, I often feel that my racial group is not worthwhile.
questions.11: In general, others respect my raceity.
questions.12: My raceity is unimportant to my sense of what kind of a person I am.
questions.13: I often feel I'm a useless member of my racial group.
questions.14: I feel good about the raceity I belong to.
questions.15: In general, others think that my racial group is unworthy.
questions.16: In general, belonging to my raceity is an important part of my self-image.

prompt: You should reply numbers from 1 to 7 in the following statements. Please evaluate the following descriptions based on your actual feelings and experiences. The criteria for evaluation and judgment are as follows: 1 (strongly disagree), 2 (disagree), 3 (somewhat disagree), 4 (neutral), 5 (somewhat agree), 6 (agree), 7 (strongly agree). Here are the statements, score them one by one:

name: CSWS
discription: A comprehensive analysis of the psychometric properties of the contingencies of self-worth scale (CSWS)

questions.1: When I think I look attractive, I feel good about myself.
questions.2: My self-worth is based on God's love.
questions.3: I feel worthwhile when I perform better than others on a task or skill.
questions.4: My self-esteem is unrelated to how I feel about the way my body looks.
questions.5: Doing something I know is wrong makes me lose my self-respect.
questions.6: I don't care if other people have a negative opinion about me.
questions.7: Knowing that my family members love me makes me feel good about myself.
questions.8: I feel worthwhile when I have God's love.
questions.9: I can't respect myself if others don't respect me.
questions.10: My self-worth is not influenced by the quality of my relationships with my family members.
questions.11: Whenever I follow my moral principles, my sense of self-respect gets a boost.
questions.12: Knowing that I am better than others on a task raises my self-esteem.
questions.13: My opinion about myself isn't tied to how well I do in school.
questions.14: I couldn't respect myself if I didn't live up to a moral code.
questions.15: I don't care what other people think of me.
questions.16: When my family members are proud of me, my sense of self-worth increases.
questions.17: My self-esteem is influenced by how attractive I think my face or facial features are.
questions.18: My self-esteem would suffer if I didn't have God's love.
questions.19: Doing well in school gives me a sense of self-respect.
questions.20: Doing better than others gives me a sense of self-respect.
questions.21: My sense of self-worth suffers whenever I think I don't look good.
questions.22: I feel better about myself when I know I'm doing well academically.
questions.23: What others think of me has no effect on what I think about myself.
questions.24: When I don't feel loved by my family, my self-esteem goes down.
questions.25: My self-worth is affected by how well I do when I am competing with others.
questions.26: My self-esteem goes up when I feel that God loves me.
questions.27: My self-esteem is influenced by my academic performance.
questions.28: My self-esteem would suffer if I did something unethical.
questions.29: It is important to my self-respect that I have a family that cares about me.
questions.30: My self-esteem does not depend on whether or not I feel attractive.
questions.31: When I think that I'm disobeying God, I feel bad about myself.
questions.32: My self-worth is influenced by how well I do on competitive tasks.
questions.33: I feel bad about myself whenever my academic performance is lacking.
questions.34: My self-esteem depends on whether or not I follow my moral/ethical principles.
questions.35: My self-esteem depends on the opinions others hold of me.
